entity.name: `popover` attribute (Popover API)
entity.description: HTML syntax and JS API facilitating popovers such as overlays, popups, menus etc.
entity.descriptionHtml: HTML syntax and JS API facilitating popovers such as overlays, popups, menus etc.
entity.descriptionClean: HTML syntax and JS API facilitating popovers such as overlays, popups, menus etc.

example.code: Popover content
example.codeHighlighted: <button popovertarget="foo">Toggle the popover</button> <div id="foo" popover>Popover content</div>

resources.title: The Popover API (previously Popup) · Issue #743 · w3ctag/design-reviews · GitHub

webFeature.description_html: The popover HTML attribute creates an overlay to display content on top of other page content. Popovers can be shown declaratively using HTML, or using the showPopover() method.
webFeature.name: Popover

example.codeHighlighted: .anchor { anchor-name: --my-anchor; } .target { position: absolute; position-anchor: --my-anchor; position-area: start end; }

resources.title: Tether elements to each other with CSS anchor positioning

webFeature.description_html: Anchor positioning places an element based on the position of another element. For example, you can place a tooltip next to the content it references.
webFeature.name: Anchor positioning

resources.title: Smooth and simple transitions with the View Transitions API

webFeature.description_html: The @view-transition CSS rule sets whether a document opts-in to transitions between documents in a multi-page application. Both the old and new document must opt-in for a transition to be triggered.
webFeature.name: Cross-document view transitions

entity.name: `<dialog>`
entity.description: Creates a modal or non-modal dialog box, such as a confirmation prompt or a subwindow used to enter data.
entity.descriptionHtml: Creates a modal or non-modal dialog box, such as a confirmation prompt or a subwindow used to enter data.
entity.descriptionClean: Creates a modal or non-modal dialog box, such as a confirmation prompt or a subwindow used to enter data.

example.code:
<dialog id="confirm">
	<form method="dialog">
		Are you sure?
		<button value="1">Yes</button>
		<button value="0">No</button>
	</form>
</dialog>
example.codeHighlighted: <dialog id="confirm"> <form method="dialog"> Are you sure? <button value="1">Yes</button> <button value="0">No</button> </form> </dialog>

webFeature.description_html: The <dialog> HTML element represents a modal or non-modal dialog box, such as a confirmation prompt or a subwindow used to enter data.
webFeature.name: <dialog>

entity.name: Customizable Select
entity.description: Stylable, customizable dropdown control. Previously `<selectlist>` and `<selectmenu>`.
entity.descriptionHtml: Stylable, customizable dropdown control. Previously <selectlist> and <selectmenu>.
entity.descriptionClean: Stylable, customizable dropdown control. Previously <selectlist> and <selectmenu>.

example.codeHighlighted: select, ::picker(select) { appearance: base-select; }

resources.title: The selectmenu HTML Tag | CSS-Tricks - CSS-Tricks
Advanced Form Control Styling With Selectmenu And Anchoring API — Smashing Magazine

webFeature.description_html: The <select> element's appearance, including the button, selected option, picker dropdown, and options, can be customized using CSS.
webFeature.name: Customizable <select>

entity.name: `<datalist>`
entity.description: Method of providing a list of presets for a user to select in a form control, while still allowing custom options.
entity.descriptionHtml: Method of providing a list of presets for a user to select in a form control, while still allowing custom options.
entity.descriptionClean: Method of providing a list of presets for a user to select in a form control, while still allowing custom options.

example.code:
<input name="country" list="countries">
<datalist id="countries">
  <option>Afghanistan</option>
  ...
</datalist>
example.codeHighlighted: <input name="country" list="countries"> <datalist id="countries"> <option>Afghanistan</option> ... </datalist>

webFeature.description_html: The <datalist> element sets recommended values for an <input> element. Browsers may show a dropdown menu of all values or match values as the user types.
webFeature.name: <datalist>

entity.name: File System Access API
entity.description: Access files and directories on the user's local device and create writable files that can be updated.
entity.descriptionHtml: Access files and directories on the user's local device and create writable files that can be updated.
entity.descriptionClean: Access files and directories on the user's local device and create writable files that can be updated.

example.codeHighlighted: const handle = await window.showSaveFilePicker(); const writable = await handle.createWritable(); await writable.write("Hello, world!"); await writable.close();

webFeature.description_html: The showOpenFilePicker(), showDirectoryPicker(), and showSaveFilePicker() methods request access to files and directories on the user's device and returns a handle for reading and writing to them.
webFeature.name: File system access

example.codeHighlighted: html { scroll-timeline: --page-scroll block; } @keyframes grow-progress { from { transform: scaleX(0); } to { transform: scaleX(1); } } #progress { animation: grow-progress auto linear; animation-timeline: --page-scroll; }

resources.title: Unleash the Power of Scroll-Driven Animations
Animate elements on scroll with Scroll-driven animations

webFeature.description_html: The animation-timeline, scroll-timeline, and view-timeline CSS properties advance animations based on the user's scroll position.
webFeature.name: Scroll-driven animations

entity.name: Web Bluetooth
entity.description: Connect to and communicate with nearby Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) devices.
entity.descriptionHtml: Connect to and communicate with nearby Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) devices.
entity.descriptionClean: Connect to and communicate with nearby Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) devices.

example.code: const device = await navigator.bluetooth.requestDevice({ filters: [{ services: ["heart_rate"] }] });
example.codeHighlighted: const device = await navigator.bluetooth.requestDevice({ filters: [{ services: ["heart_rate"] }] });

resources.title: Communicating with Bluetooth devices over JavaScript

webFeature.description_html: The Web Bluetooth API enables selecting and communicating with nearby Bluetooth devices.
webFeature.name: Web Bluetooth

entity.name: `<input type="file">`
entity.description: Pain points specific to `<input type="file">`, especially around styling the button and displaying selected files.
entity.descriptionHtml: Pain points specific to <input type="file">, especially around styling the button and displaying selected files.
entity.descriptionClean: Pain points specific to <input type="file">, especially around styling the button and displaying selected files.

entity.name: WebGPU
entity.description: A JavaScript API that provides low-level access to the GPU for high-performance graphics and parallel computation in the browser.
entity.descriptionHtml: A JavaScript API that provides low-level access to the GPU for high-performance graphics and parallel computation in the browser.
entity.descriptionClean: A JavaScript API that provides low-level access to the GPU for high-performance graphics and parallel computation in the browser.

example.code:
const adapter = await navigator.gpu.requestAdapter();
const device = await adapter?.requestDevice();
example.codeHighlighted: const adapter = await navigator.gpu.requestAdapter(); const device = await adapter?.requestDevice();

resources.title: WebGPU: Unlocking modern GPU access in the browser

entity.name: Clipboard API
entity.description: Provides the ability to respond to clipboard commands (cut, copy, and paste), as well as to asynchronously read from and write to the system clipboard.
entity.descriptionHtml: Provides the ability to respond to clipboard commands (cut, copy, and paste), as well as to asynchronously read from and write to the system clipboard.
entity.descriptionClean: Provides the ability to respond to clipboard commands (cut, copy, and paste), as well as to asynchronously read from and write to the system clipboard.

webFeature.description_html: The navigator.clipboard API asynchronously reads and writes to the system clipboard.
webFeature.name: Async clipboard

entity.name: Web Share API
entity.description: Exposes a mechanism for sharing content to various user-selected targets.
entity.descriptionHtml: Exposes a mechanism for sharing content to various user-selected targets.
entity.descriptionClean: Exposes a mechanism for sharing content to various user-selected targets.

example.code: navigator.share(shareData)
example.codeHighlighted: navigator.share(shareData)

resources.title: Integrate with the OS sharing UI with the Web Share API

webFeature.description_html: The navigator.share() method invokes the device's native sharing mechanism and passes text, links, files, and other content to share targets.
webFeature.name: navigator.share()

entity.name: `focusgroup` attribute
entity.description: Facilitate keyboard focus navigation using the keyboard arrow keys among a set of focusable elements.
entity.descriptionHtml: Facilitate keyboard focus navigation using the keyboard arrow keys among a set of focusable elements.
entity.descriptionClean: Facilitate keyboard focus navigation using the keyboard arrow keys among a set of focusable elements.

example.codeHighlighted: <div focusgroup="wrap horizontal"> <!-- child elements --> </div>

resources.title: 1286127 -       chromium -      An open-source project to help move the web forward. -     Monorail

entity.name: `<details>` and `<summary>`
entity.description: A disclosure widget that can be toggled to hide or show content interactively.
entity.descriptionHtml: A disclosure widget that can be toggled to hide or show content interactively.
entity.descriptionClean: A disclosure widget that can be toggled to hide or show content interactively.

example.code:
<details>
    <summary>Details</summary>
    Longer content
</details>
example.codeHighlighted: <details> <summary>Details</summary> Longer content </details>

webFeature.description_html: The <details> element is a disclosure widget which can be expanded to reveal additional content. When closed, only the nested <summary> element is visible.
webFeature.name: <details>

webFeature.description_html: CSS grid is a two-dimensional layout system, which lays content out in rows and columns.
webFeature.name: Grid

example.codeHighlighted: a:has(> img) { border: 2px solid grey; }

webFeature.description_html: The :has() CSS functional pseudo-class matches an element if any of the selectors passed as parameters would match at least one element.
webFeature.name: :has()

entity.name: JPEG XL
entity.description: An image format optimized for web environments.
entity.descriptionHtml: An image format optimized for web environments.
entity.descriptionClean: An image format optimized for web environments.

example.codeHighlighted: <img src="image.jxl" />

webFeature.description_html: The JPEG XL image format is a raster graphics file format that supports animation, alpha transparency, and lossy as well as lossless compression.
webFeature.name: JPEG XL

entity.name: Navigation API
entity.description: Initiate, intercept, and manage navigation actions, examine history entries. Successor to the older `history` and `location` APIs.
entity.descriptionHtml: Initiate, intercept, and manage navigation actions, examine history entries. Successor to the older history and location APIs.
entity.descriptionClean: Initiate, intercept, and manage navigation actions, examine history entries. Successor to the older history and location APIs.

example.code:
navigation.navigate(url, {history: "push"});
navigation.addEventListener("navigate", interceptNavigation);
example.codeHighlighted: navigation.navigate(url, {history: "push"}); navigation.addEventListener("navigate", interceptNavigation);

resources.title: The navigation API has moved to the HTML Standard
GitHub - WICG/navigation-api: The new navigation API provides a new interface for navigations and session history, with a focus on single-page application navigations.

entity.name: Shadow DOM
entity.description: Encapsulate elements not visible from the outside, and style them with CSS not affecting the rest of the page.
entity.descriptionHtml: Encapsulate elements not visible from the outside, and style them with CSS not affecting the rest of the page.
entity.descriptionClean: Encapsulate elements not visible from the outside, and style them with CSS not affecting the rest of the page.

example.code: this.shadowRoot = this.attachShadow({mode: "open"});
example.codeHighlighted: this.shadowRoot = this.attachShadow({mode: "open"});

webFeature.description_html: Shadow DOM allows you to attach encapsulated "shadow" DOM trees to elements. A shadow DOM tree is a separate component, isolated from the scripts and styles in other parts of the document. This is a part of Web Components.
webFeature.name: Shadow DOM

entity.name: `<dialog>`
entity.description: Creates a modal or non-modal dialog box, such as a confirmation prompt or a subwindow used to enter data.

entity.name: `<dialog closedby="any">`
entity.description: Allows the dialog to be closed by clicking outside of it (light dismiss).
entity.descriptionHtml: Allows the dialog to be closed by clicking outside of it (light dismiss).
entity.descriptionClean: Allows the dialog to be closed by clicking outside of it (light dismiss).

webFeature.description_html: The closedby HTML attribute for <dialog> sets which user actions close a dialog. For example, closedby="any" allows the dialog to be closed by clicking outside of it.
webFeature.name: <dialog closedby>

resources.title: Smooth and simple transitions with the View Transitions API

entity.name: File System Access API
entity.description: Access files and directories on the user's local device and create writable files that can be updated.
entity.descriptionHtml: Access files and directories on the user's local device and create writable files that can be updated.
entity.descriptionClean: Access files and directories on the user's local device and create writable files that can be updated.

example.codeHighlighted: const handle = await window.showSaveFilePicker(); const writable = await handle.createWritable(); await writable.write("Hello, world!"); await writable.close();

webFeature.description_html: The showOpenFilePicker(), showDirectoryPicker(), and showSaveFilePicker() methods request access to files and directories on the user's device and returns a handle for reading and writing to them.
webFeature.name: File system access

entity.name: `command` and `commandfor` attributes (Command Invokers)
entity.description: A declarative way for `<button>` to invoke predefined custom commands.
entity.descriptionHtml: A declarative way for <button> to invoke predefined custom commands.
entity.descriptionClean: A declarative way for <button> to invoke predefined custom commands.

example.code:
<button commandfor="mydialog" command="show-modal">
  Show modal dialog
</button>
<dialog id="mydialog">
  <button commandfor="mydialog" command="close">
    Close
  </button>
  *dialog content*
</dialog>
example.codeHighlighted: <button commandfor="mydialog" command="show-modal"> Show modal dialog </button> <dialog id="mydialog"> <button commandfor="mydialog" command="close"> Close </button> *dialog content* </dialog>

resources.title: Invoker Commands: Additional Ways to Work With Dialog, Popover… and More?

webFeature.description_html: The command and commandfor attributes for the <button> HTML element dispatch an action to an element when the button is invoked (by click or keystroke), as a declarative alternative to addEventListener() calls or onclick attribute handlers.
webFeature.name: Invoker commands

entity.name: `command` and `commandfor` attributes (Command Invokers)
entity.description: A declarative way for `<button>` to invoke predefined custom commands.
entity.descriptionHtml: A declarative way for <button> to invoke predefined custom commands.

entity.name: WebUSB API
entity.description: Directly communicate with USB devices, enabling data exchange without drivers or native apps.
entity.descriptionHtml: Directly communicate with USB devices, enabling data exchange without drivers or native apps.
entity.descriptionClean: Directly communicate with USB devices, enabling data exchange without drivers or native apps.

example.code:
const device = await navigator.usb.requestDevice({ filters: [{ vendorId: 0x2341 }] });
await device.open();
example.codeHighlighted: const device = await navigator.usb.requestDevice({ filters: [{ vendorId: 0x2341 }] }); await device.open();

resources.title: Access USB Devices on the Web

webFeature.description_html: The WebUSB API exposes USB compatible devices to web pages.
webFeature.name: WebUSB

entity.name: `SpeechRecognition`
entity.description: API that converts microphone input to text.
entity.descriptionHtml: API that converts microphone input to text.
entity.descriptionClean: API that converts microphone input to text.

example.codeHighlighted: const rec = new SpeechRecognition(); rec.lang = "en-US"; rec.addEventListener("result", e => console.log(e.results[0][0].transcript)); rec.start();

webFeature.description_html: The SpeechRecognition API converts audio into text using the device's speech recognition service.
webFeature.name: Speech recognition
